Associate Newsletter October 2012
Independent Work Going Mainstream? MBO's Second Annual State of Independence Report Amongst a turbulent economic environment, independent work continues to be a sustainable, financially rewarding and personally fulfilling career for a growing number of Americans, according to findings captured in MBO's second annual State of Independence in America <http://bit.ly/RqR13n> workforce study report, released last month. It also reveals that independent work is a major contributor to the US economy, bringing in about one trillion dollars in revenue. "Our 2012 State of Independence survey offers the first and most comprehensive year over year study, exploring the independent workforce," said Gene Zaino, CEO of MBO Partners. "The findings further reinforce the fact that independent employment is not a cyclical trend but a growing reality in today's workfoorce due to structural shifts in overall employment practices." Learn more <http://bit.ly/OYJI6c>
MBO Partners Appoints First Independent Consultant Advisory Board Publicized in a recent press release <http://bit.ly/QCuVvz>, MBO Partners is pleased to annouce the appointment of 7 independent professionals to form a new Independent Consulting Executive Board (ICEB) <http://www.mboco.com/we-are-mbo/advisoryboard>. Serving in an advisory capacity, the ICEB's mission is to provide objective advice and counsel on what is necessary to create an environment that delivers exceptional value to independent consultants and their clients. These valuable insights will enable MBO Partners to fine tune its strategic intiatives, service offerings and market awareness. CEO CORNER
The Secrets to Writing the Perfect LinkedIn Profile
There's no avoiding it anymore; if you're an independent consultant, you need a LinkedIn profile - and a good one too. Your potential clients will google you before they even consider calling you to talk, and that initial hit on a search engine is the first part of the modern interview.
If your profile was hastily thrown together, that's no different than handing in an incomplete resume. More> <http://info.mbopartners.com/CEOCornerOctober2012.html> BOOK REVIEW
Dennis Kanegaye dishes on "let's get real or let's not play"
For independent consultants, identifying, qualifying and closing your next assignment can be a daunting, frustrating and sometimes frightening proposition- but it is an important and necessary part of your business success. Have you ever been absolutely certain a deal was yours, but were suprised at the last minute when it was awarded to someone else? I have read many business development books over the years, but find myself going back to reading sections of "Let's Get Real or Let's Not Play." More > <http://info.mbopartners.com/BookReviewDennisKanegayeOctober2012.html>
MARKETING CORNER
Meet Independent reinhard Hillefeld of Connecticut
"Working as an independent can mean different things to different people. You need a certain temperament to do it successfully" says Reinhard Hillefeld, who worked at PepsiCo as a consultant for over 11 years, rising from a developer to a senior architect. When an unplanned sequence of events led him to become an independent contractor, he joined Oracle's Business Intelligence Consulting practice in NY. That was his first taste of the consulting world and he never looked back. More > <http://www.mbopartners.com/state-of-independence/meet-the-independents-ct.php> SPOTLIGHT ON SERVICE
Get to Know business manager ashleigh johnson
Get to know MBO Partners' Business Manager Ashleigh Johnson, of Round Hill, VA, a graduate of East Carolina University.
Assigned to the Southwest Region, Ashleigh has had the privilege of working with a number of retired military veterans and her favorite part of working with her associates is building unique relationships and learning about their lives and the experiences that led them to consulting.
